data.title: Fantastic Burger.  Ice Cold Beer.  Lot's of Laughs.
data.text: Beautiful gardens with lot's of shade and a water view.  The best burger I've ever had. The service was fantastic and the people we're very funny.  Great house band that encourages other musicians to join them on the outdoor stage.  Great place for casual dining and entertainment.

data.title: lousy burger
data.text: The sign outside sez "voted best burger"  ... don;t believe everything ya read ... more like a meatball on a slider bun ... turns out Steve, the owner, cooks up a bunch of these on the grill and they're nuked as they are ordered ... yuk at best

data.title: The owner is in the store.
data.text: We like to look for local owned waterfront dining so off to Steve B Waterfront Cafe. The ambiance was fun although it is not really right on the waterfront; but then the restaurant across the street and ON the waterfront had no outside dining. The owner was outside at a table with friends and welcomed us warmly. We had a beer and wine and ordered their special for the day (corned beef and cabbage for $7.00). It was surprisingly good in this era of everything being deep fried. My husband had a dog with sour kraut also very tasty. I liked the ambiance and would go back again.

data.title: how is this place still open
data.text: only drink whatever is in a sealed bottle..looked interesting  it was not  impaired owner with associates,,

data.title: Live Music!
data.text: My husband and I heard some live music and followed it to this great waterfront place. Nice cold beers and appetizers to enjoy the tunes from two guys singing outside. Waitress was friendly and so was the owner. It's also known for great burgers!

data.title: Not a biergarden
data.text: Girls were shopping so my friend and I decided to stop at the Biergarden for a brew.  Went in and their selection was very limited for a biergarden. Their sign said Biergarden.  Also, I paid for two $4 beers with a $20 and got $2 change.  I told the gal I gave her a $20 bill, I know as I am one that lines up the bills in my wallet by denomination.  She politely pulled out an envelope, searched through it and pulled out a 10, then another and said I gave her a 10.  I don't argue, just won't go back.  Did not have food and when the girls arrived we did not have anything else.

data.title: Best Burger in the world
data.text: This is the best Burger you will ever eat.  The flavor is outstanding. Steve has his own flavors but this is the best.  If you are in the area please visit him. Let him know E & J sent you his way.  Friday's he has bands and entertainment.  Great job Steve thank you.

data.title: I love the down to earth atmosphere and humor
data.text: My second visit to Fort Meyers and my first stop after checking in to my hotel. I love draft beers and love to talk about the area. Great place to learn the new history   Great service, great patio this year and look forward to expansion plans. Excellent food like you might have with a home barbecue. The staff makes conversation and has unique games to play😀

data.title: Odd bar with questionable food
data.text: We wanted to try something different for lunch so we stopped at this cafe for lunch and it was certainly different but not in a good way. When we walked up, two guys were out front drinking beer and told us the gal inside would take care of us. A gruff server came up to us and said "the bacon cheeseburger is the best in town" so that's what we ordered. She walked next to the bar where there was a cooler and a microwave and then appeared with our burgers. It was so strange - there was no cook top or grill to be seen. How did they make the burgers? Were they cooked earlier and just microwaved? It was scary and confusing at the same time. The burger had a funky smoky sweet flavor that I wasn't sure was good or terrible. It came with two sides that were served in small condiment containers. One cool thing about this place is that that server brought some slices of lemon loaf to the table as a free dessert. During our lunch, a movie about a giant man-eating spider was on and it was quite graphic. Not sure that would be my top pick for movies to watch while I am eating....definitely a unique experience that I shall check off the to-do list and not return again.

data.title: Check the web for health code violations for this establishment
data.text: Be careful. If you're someone that is concerned about cleanliness, then you should search this place on the web. If you're someone that doesn't care and wants an experience, then visit and judge for yourself.

data.title: Funky little bar
data.text: Great little bar in downtown Fort Myers. Not for all, you have to be very down to earth and just want a beer and a hot dog. They seem to have music and comedy but we were there on a Monday afternoon. Not a place to go for eating, but a dog & beer on a hot day, worth my time.

data.title: Gitchy Place for Locals
data.text: A must have experience, at least once! The hamburgers are some of the best in the area and the atmosphere is not to be missed! If you enjoy listening to live music by locals, this is the place. You never know who will show up. The day I went there were a couple of really good musicians. Be prepared though, this is not your usual "Bier Garden". It is a true local place, and comes with the "flavor" of the area. Fun time!
